answers.answer: Anything that you have or have gone through to risk the chances of you delivering a healthy term baby.
Multiple miscarriages,  high blood pressure, diabetes, cancer... Theres a lot of things that could classify you as high risk.
Also have endometriosis. And have had one surgery for that. I've always been told I'd never get pregnant.
So do I. I had some surgery for it, but I was told I could still have kids. Your doc will know whether to classify you as high risk or not. They'll monitor baby more frequently.
Thank you so much for your input :) put me at ease.

question: What exactly classifies something as high risk?I'm 17 with  ongoing,  undiagnosed heart problems for about 4 years now. They don't know exactly what it is or why, just that it isn't life threatening. It is under control for the most part and I'm on a modified high sodium diet.  I'm 8wks and so far I have done well with keeping myself afloat. Just curious.  Thanks!
title: High Risk Pregnancy?
